       output_metas = expand_outputs([(m, need_source_download, need_reparse_in_env)])
     File "/home/antoine/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/conda_build/render.py", line 735, in expand_outputs
       for (output_dict, m) in _m.copy().get_output_metadata_set(permit_unsatisfiable_variants=False):

lihalite commented on issue #4473: ARROW-5511: [Packaging] Enable Flight in Conda packages
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4473#issuecomment-499514672
 
 
   It's because `ARROW_VERSION` needs to be set (the CI scripts do so) `env ARROW_VERSION=0.14.0 conda build dev/tasks/conda-recipes/arrow-cpp/`

lihalite commented on issue #4473: ARROW-5511: [Packaging] Enable Flight in Conda packages
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4473#issuecomment-499520583
 
 
   Ah sorry, forgot conda-forge is needed, and there appears to be a config file to pin certain packages: `env ARROW_VERSION=0.14.0 conda build dev/tasks/conda-recipes/arrow-cpp/ -c conda-forge -m dev/tasks/conda-recipes/variants/osx_python3.7.yaml `
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

lihalite commented on issue #4473: ARROW-5511: [Packaging] Enable Flight in Conda packages
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4473#issuecomment-499520583
 
 
   Ah sorry, forgot conda-forge is needed, and there appears to be a config file to pin certain packages: `env ARROW_VERSION=0.14.0 conda build dev/tasks/conda-recipes/arrow-cpp/ -c conda-forge -m dev/tasks/conda-recipes/variants/osx_python3.7.yaml ` (of course use linux_python3.7.yaml or your desired config)
